Instance.description: A Skill is a specialized Statistic with a fixed min_value of 0 and a max_value calculated as the sum of its level_list.

TunableList.name: _decay_rate_overrides
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: ad_data
TunableList.description: A list of Vector2 points that define the desire curve for this commodity.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableVariant.name: age_up_skill_transition_data
TunableVariant.description:
Data used to modify the value of a new skill based on the level of this skill.
e.g. Toddler Communication skill transfers into Child Social skill.

Tunable.name: new_skill
Tunable.description: The new skill.

TunableList.name: skill_data
TunableList.description:
A mapping between this skill's levels and the new skill's internal value.
The keys are user facing skill levels.
The values are the internal statistic value, not the user facing skill level.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description:
This skill's level.
This is the actual user facing skill level.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description:
The new skill's value.
This is the internal statistic value, not the user facing skill level."

TunableList.name: ages
TunableList.description: Allowed ages for this skill.

TunableVariant.name: communicable_by_interaction_tag
TunableVariant.description:
List of Tag and loot pairs that will trigger if either the actor or target of an interaction has this statistic to give the first loot whose tag matches any tag on the interaction.
So you could do one loot for high risk socials, (tagged as such) a different loot for low risk socials (tagged as such) a third loot for high risk object interactions (licking bowl, maybe?), and fourth loot for low risk object interaction "generically using an object".

Tunable.name: loot
Tunable.description: The loot to give.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: Tag on interaction required to apply this loot.

TunableVariant.name: delayed_decay_rate
TunableVariant.description: When enabled contains the tuning for delayed decay. Delayed decay is decay that happens if the value of the commodity hasn't changed in some time.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: All of the tuning for delayed decay rate.

TunableList.name: decay_rate_overrides
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

Tunable.name: final_delay_override
Tunable.description: The override for how long, in Sim Minutes, the final delay is before the actual decay begins, after displaying the warning.

Tunable.name: initial_delay_override
Tunable.description: The override for how long, in Sim Minutes, the initial delay is before the warning is given about decay starting.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: decay_warning
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the notification to show to warn the user that a specific statistic is about to start decaying.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: This field is deprecated. Please use 'icon' instead.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: primary_icon_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, associate a response to clicking the primary icon.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The response associated to the primary icon.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: The dialog's text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define text tokens to be used to localized text.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the text tokens that are available to all text fields in the dialog, such as title, text, responses, default and initial text values, tooltips, etc.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data

TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic

Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: delayed_decay_rate
Tunable.description: The decay rate for this stat that starts after a delayed amount of time where the value of the skill does not change.

Tunable.name: final_delay
Tunable.description: Tim, in sim minutes, after the warning is shown that the decay will actually begin.

Tunable.name: initial_delay
Tunable.description: Time, in sim minutes, before the warning that a decay will start will be shown.

Tunable.name: npc_decay
Tunable.description: By default decay doesn't happen for NPC sims. If enabled this will turn on decay of this statistic for NPC sims.

TunableEnum.name: gallery_load_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When owner of commodity is loaded from the gallery, tune this to determine if commodity should be loaded or not.
DONT_LOAD = Don't load statistic when owner is coming from gallery
LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT = Load only if statistic is being added to an object. If this statistic is tuned as a linked stat to a state, make sure the state is also marked as gallery persisted. i.e. Statistics like fish_freshness or gardening_groth. Switching on this bit has performance implications when downloading a lot from the gallery. Please discuss with a GPE when setting this tunable.
LOAD_ONLY_FOR_SIM = Load only if statistic is being added to a sim. LOAD_FOR_ALL = Always load commodity. This has the same ramifications as LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT if owner is an object.

Tunable.name: hidden
Tunable.description: If checked, this skill will be hidden.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Icon to be displayed for the Skill.

Tunable.name: initial_value
Tunable.description: The initial value for this stat.

TunableList.name: level_data
TunableList.description: Level-specific information, such as notifications to be displayed to level up.

TunableList.name: actor_mixers
TunableList.description: Mixers this adds to an associated actor object. (When targeting something else.)

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The super affordance these mixers are associated with.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: Set of mixer affordances associated with the super affordance.

Tunable.description: Linked mixer affordance.

TunableTuple.name: level_up_notification
TunableTuple.description: The notification to display when the Sim obtains this level. The text will be provided two tokens: the Sim owning the skill and a number representing the 1-based skill level

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: This field is deprecated. Please use 'icon' instead.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_icon_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, associate a response to clicking the secondary icon.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The response associated to the secondary icon.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: The dialog's text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

TunableVariant.name: level_up_screen_slam
enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a ScreenSlam tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Tunable Screen Slams!

Tunable.name: active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If true, the screen slam will be only be shown if the active Sim triggers it.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: A sting to play at the same time as the screen slam. ***Some screen slams may appear to play a sting, but the audio is actually tuned on something else. Example: On CareerLevel tuning there already is a tunable, Promotion Audio Sting, to trigger a sting, so one is not necessary on the screen slam. Make sure to avoid having to stings play simultaneously.***

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableTuple.name: key_based
TunableTuple.description:
Screen Slam visual is dictated by a string key.
Verify with your UI partner what this should be.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: Key to use for the screenslam. This will be typically tied to what animation will play. Verify with your UI partner what the correct value to use will be.

TunableTuple.name: size_based
TunableTuple.description: Screen Slam visual is dictated by the value of the size tunable.

TunableEnum.name: screen_slam_size
TunableEnum.description: Screen slam size.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: , Icon to be displayed for the screen Slam.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: " Text of the screen slam.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: Title of the screen slam.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a ScreenSlam tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: loot
TunableList.description: A loot to apply for achieving this level.

TunableList.name: rewards
TunableList.description: A reward to give for achieving this level.

TunableVariant.description: A single specific reward.

TunableTuple.name: additional_business_customer_count
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks increments in the customer countfor a business type.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

Tunable.name: customer_count_increment
Tunable.description: The amount to increment the customer count for the tuned business type. You can also use this to decrement the customer count but the code will never allow a negative customer count or the sim cap to be violated. This change is permanent across all business types so use with caution!

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: additional_business_markup
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks increments in the markup multiplier for a business type.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

Tunable.name: markup_increment
Tunable.description: The amount to increment the markup multiplier for the tuned business type. You can also use the to decrement the markup multiplier but the code will never allow a negative multiplier. This change is permanent across all business types so use with caution!

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: additional_employee_slot
TunableTuple.description: A reward that unlocks an additional employee slot for the entire household's businesses.

TunableEnum.name: business_type
TunableEnum.description: The business type to which this reward should be given.

TunableEnum.name: employee_type
TunableEnum.description: The employee type to increment the slot count.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.

TunableTuple.name: bucks
TunableTuple.description: A reward that gives the specified bucks.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The amount of Bucks to award. Must be a positive value.

TunableEnum.name: bucks_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of Bucks to grant.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: skill_level_buff
TunableVariant.description: The buff to place on a Sim when they reach this specific level of skill.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The buff to place on a Sim when they reach this specific level of skill.

TunableList.name: super_affordances
TunableList.description: Super affordances this adds to the Sim.

Tunable.description: A super affordance added to this Sim.

TunableList.name: target_super_affordances
TunableList.description: Super affordances this adds to the target.

TunableTuple.description: Tunables related to a specific affordance we are providing, with the ability to override specifics about targets, restrictions, and dependencies.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: An affordance we make available. Pay attention to who this affordance is provided on. See the provided affordances description for more info.

Tunable.name: allow_self
Tunable.description: If set, the Sim running the providing interaction is allowed to also run the provided interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_filter
TunableVariant.description: Define the type of objects this affordance is provided on.

TunableTuple.name: allow_all
TunableTuple.description: No requirements. All objects are valid.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_portal_flags
TunableTuple.description: Specify portal requirements for the object.

TunableList.name: portal_flags
TunableList.description: The object must have any of these portal flags in order to satisfy the requirement.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_sim
TunableTuple.description: Specify Sim or non-Sim requirements for the object.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_state
TunableTuple.description: Specify state requirements for the object.

TunableTuple.name: states
TunableTuple.description: The required states to pass this test.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: The state value.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_tags
TunableTuple.description: Specify tag requirements for the object.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The object must have any of these tags in order to satisfy the requirement.

TunableTuple.name: filter_by_terrain
TunableTuple.description: Specify a requirement of the object being the terrain.

TunableList.name: disallowed_surfaces
TunableList.description: Routing surfaces where the placement of this object should fail.

Tunable.name: locked_description
Tunable.description: The skill description when it's locked.

TunableEnum.name: min_lod_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum Sim info LOD necessary for this information to persist on the sim info. e.g. A statistic tuned to FULL will not persist on sims that lower than FULL. LOD order, high to low, is FULL, INTERACTED, BASE, BACKGROUND, MINIMUM.

TunableList.name: monetary_payout_multipliers
TunableList.description: Multipliers this skill applies to the monetary payout amount of affordances.

TunableList.name: affordance_list
TunableList.description: List of affordances this multiplier will effect.

TunableList.name: curve
TunableList.description: Tunable curve where the X-axis defines the skill level, and the Y-axis defines the associated multiplier.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill
Tunable.description: If checked, this modifier will look at the current effective skill value. If unchecked, this modifier will look at the actual skill value.

Tunable.name: mood_id
Tunable.description: When this mood is set and active sim matches mood, the UI will display a special effect on the skill bar to represent that this skill is getting a bonus because of the mood.

TunableList.name: next_level_teaser
TunableList.description: Tooltip which describes what the next level entails.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

Tunable.name: persisted_tuning
Tunable.description: Whether this statistic will persist when saving a Sim or an object. For example, a Sims's SI score statistic should never persist.

Tunable.name: priority
Tunable.description: Skill priority. Higher priority skills will trump other skills when being displayed on the UI. When a Sim gains multiple skills at the same time, only the highest priority one will display a progress bar over the Sim's head.

Tunable.name: respect_lod_on_add
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will not add the statistic if the LOD value of the Sim is lower than the required LOD of the statistic. Otherwise instanced Sims will be allowed to get statistics of higher LOD values.

Tunable.name: skill_description
Tunable.description: The skill's normal description.

TunableEnum.name: skill_level_type
TunableEnum.description: Skill level list to use.

TunableList.name: skill_unlocks_on_max
TunableList.description: A list of skills that become unlocked when this skill is maxed.

Tunable.description: A skill to unlock.

TunableTuple.name: stat_asm_param
TunableTuple.description:
Tuning that defines how this skill and the various skill levels are set on animations played by the Sim.
If an animator wants to play different clips to indicate skill progression, use this tuning to pass that data to the ASM.
If the clips are part of an interaction ASM, you can tune the "Animation Stat" field on the SI to determine which skill is used to represent progression.
If the clips are part of various types of ASMs, such as posture transitions or "Get/Put" animations, check the "Always Apply" checkbox, which will always set the paramter on all animations played by the Sim. If doing so, ensure the parameter name is unique, i.e. includes the skill's name.

Tunable.name: always_apply
Tunable.description: If checked, this parameter is always applied on any ASM involving the owning Sim.

Tunable.name: asm_param_name
Tunable.description: The asm param name.

TunableList.name: level_ranges
TunableList.description: The value mapping of the stat range to stat value or user value. If use_user_value is True, the range should be user value, otherwise stat value.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The asm parameter for Sim's stat level.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Stat value fall into the range (inclusive).

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill_level
Tunable.description: If true, the effective skill level of the Sim will be used for the asm_param.

Tunable.name: use_user_value
Tunable.description: Whether use the user value or stat value to decide the asm_param.

Tunable.name: stat_name
Tunable.description: The name of this skill.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description: Multipliers this skill applies to other statistics based on its value.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The statistic this multiplier will be applied to.

TunableList.name: curve
TunableList.description: Tunable curve where the X-axis defines the skill level, and the Y-axis defines the associated multiplier.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: direction
TunableEnum.description: Direction where the multiplier should work on the statistic. For example, a tuned decrease for an object's brokenness rate will not also increase the time it takes to repair it.

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill
Tunable.description: If checked, this modifier will look at the current effective skill value. If unchecked, this modifier will look at the actual skill value.

TunableList.name: success_chance_multipliers
TunableList.description: Multipliers this skill applies to the success chance of affordances.

TunableList.name: affordance_list
TunableList.description: List of affordances this multiplier will effect.

TunableList.name: curve
TunableList.description: Tunable curve where the X-axis defines the skill level, and the Y-axis defines the associated multiplier.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill
Tunable.description: If checked, this modifier will look at the current effective skill value. If unchecked, this modifier will look at the actual skill value.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The associated categories of the skill

TunableList.name: tooltip_icon_list
TunableList.description: A list of icons to show in the tooltip of this skill.

Tunable.description: Icon that is displayed what types of objects help improve this skill.

TunableVariant.name: trend_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we associate this skill with a particular trend via tag which you can find in trend_tuning.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The trend tag we associate with this skill

Tunable.name: tutorial
Tunable.description: Tutorial instance for this skill. This will be used to bring up the skill lesson from the first notification for Sim to know this skill.

Tunable.name: update_client_for_npcs
Tunable.description:
Whether this skill will send update messages to the client for non-active household sims (NPCs).
e.g. A toddler's communication skill determines the VOX they use, so the client needs to know the skill level for all toddlers in order for this work properly.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight of the Skill with regards to autonomy. It's ignored for the purposes of sorting stats, but it's applied when scoring the actual statistic operation for the SI.
